alert.note: Alert for Blackford; Grant; Jay; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Grant, Blackford, southeastern Wells and western Jay Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartford City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Nuisance flooding may accompany these storms. These strong thunderstorms will be near...Montpelier around 540 PM EDT. Dunkirk around 545 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Redkey and Pennville. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 253 and 264. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central and east central Indiana.
